definition: silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: One area central to the privacy debate is opt-in versus opt-out.
sentences.chinese: 一区中央对隐私权的辩论是选择式银两选择退出。

sentences.english: Iceland has won three Olympic medals, one silver and two bronze medals.
sentences.chinese: 冰岛已经嬴得三枚运会的奖牌，一银两铜。

sentences.english: The river dragon help smell after arrange silver horse let them away.
sentences.chinese: 之后江龙帮闻道安排好马匹银两让他们逃走了。

sentences.english: Confiscate and seal income and silver gained by sale two?
sentences.chinese: 查封所得以及拍卖所得的银两呢？

definition: land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
(in former times) banknote with a value in silver
government repository/state provincial warehouse (esp. during Qing dynasty)
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
